Package org.tquadrat.foundation.gradle.gitpublisher.task

Class PublishToGIT

java.lang.Object
org.gradle.api.internal.AbstractTask
org.gradle.api.DefaultTask
org.tquadrat.foundation.gradle.gitpublisher.task.PublishToGIT
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<org.gradle.api.Task>, org.gradle.api.internal.DynamicObjectAware, org.gradle.api.internal.TaskInternal, org.gradle.api.plugins.ExtensionAware, org.gradle.api.Task, org.gradle.util.Configurable<org.gradle.api.Task>
public abstract class PublishToGIT extends org.gradle.api.DefaultTask
The definition of the task that does the work for the plugin GITPublisherPlugin.

    • getDebugFlag

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<Boolean> getDebugFlag()
      Returns the debug flag.
      Returns:

    • getDryRunFlag

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<Boolean> getDryRunFlag()
      The "DryRun" flag. No cleanup is performed after a dry-run.
      Returns:
      If the Property is true, the Git.push() will be executed only as a dry-run.
      See Also:
      • PushCommand.setDryRun(boolean)

    • getIgnoresList

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.ListProperty<String> getIgnoresList()

      The names of the files and folders that will not be published.

      In fact each of this list is a pattern for a file or folder name, and these these patterns follow the syntax as for the argument for FileSystem.getPathMatcher(String), only that the syntax prefix @quot;glob:" can be omitted.

      All names are relative to the project's root folder.

      Returns:
      The Property for the ignores list.

    • getJavadocLocation

      @InputDirectory @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<File> getJavadocLocation()

      Returns the Javadoc location. The contents of the given folder will be copied to the javadoc folder in the target repository.

      Returns:
      The Property for the location of the Javadoc location.

    • getKeep

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.ListProperty<String> getKeep()

      The names of the files and folders to keep in the repository even without a corresponding file or folder in the source. Usually, files in the repository will be removed from it when there is no corresponding entry in the source, because the assumption is that such a file was removed from the source. But some files may come from different build environments and should not be removed.

      Each entry contains a pattern for a file or folder name, and these these patterns follow the syntax as for the argument for FileSystem.getPathMatcher(String), only that the syntax prefix @quot;glob:" can be omitted.

      All names are relative to the repository's root folder.

      Returns:
      The Property for the "keep" list.

    • getLocalRepositoryFolder

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<String> getLocalRepositoryFolder()
      The name of the target folder for the temporary local Git repository.
      Returns:
      The Property for the name of the target folder.

    • getMetaDir

      @InputDirectory @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<File> getMetaDir()
      The folder with the files that are published in the root of the Git repository (for example the README.MD).
      Returns:
      The Property for the meta folder.

    • getPassword

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<String> getPassword()

      Returns:

    • getSourcesList

      @Input public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.ListProperty<String> getSourcesList()

      The names of the files and folders to publish.

      In fact each entry contains a pattern for a file or folder name, and these these patterns follow the syntax as for the argument for FileSystem.getPathMatcher(String), only that the syntax prefix @quot;glob:" can be omitted.

      All names are relative to the project's root folder.

      Returns:
      The Property for the sources list.

    • getUsername

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<String> getUsername()
      The username for the access to the Git repository.
      Returns:
      The Property for the Git repository username.

    • getWorkFolder

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<File> getWorkFolder()

      The work folder that should contain the temporary local Git repository.

      The default name is "gitpublishwork", the folder is relative to the project root.

      This folder will be created if it does not exist, but it will not be deleted on cleanup.

      Returns:
      The Property for the work folder.

    • getMustCleanupFlag

      @Input @Optional public abstract org.gradle.api.provider.Property<Boolean> getMustCleanupFlag()
      The flag that indicates whether the temporary repository has to be removed in the end.
      Returns:
      The Property for the flag.

    • publish

      public final void publish() throws org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException, IOException
      Publishes the artifacts to the specified Git repository.
      Throws:
      org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException - A Git operation failed
      IOException - A file operation failed.
